1.1.description: Know what the PL Network is, how Protocol Labs evolved from company to network, as well as the projects, tooling, and DApps being built on the PLN

1.2.description: Understand what the resources and tools are within the PL Network to support teams, individuals, companies, and general growth of our mission

1.3.description: Understand the methods and philosophies about how work and communication is carried out in the Protocol Labs Network & within PLN open source communities

1.0.description: Understand what IPFS is and why IPFS was started

subgoals.description: Understand what is a peer to peer (p2p) network
Know the difference between centralised, decentralised, and distributed networks
Describe limitations and challenges with centralized services versus p2p systems
Understand how IPFS is trying to design systems that are future-proof
Describe, high level, some of the solutions posed by IPFS

1.1.description: Understand Content Addressing, CIDs, and what advantages they present over location-based addressing

subgoals.description: Be able to describe what mutable data is, and why content in IPFS is immutable
Understand difference between location addressing vs content addressing
Know the different types of CIDs, and what a CID is made up of
Understand why data on IPFS needs to be pinned to be made available to the network
Identify how a garbage collection process is done on an IPFS node and how to keep data discoverable on IPFS

1.2.description: Be able to explain how content is shared on IPFS

subgoals.description: Be able to describe what content identifiers and mutable data are
Understand the challenges posed in a decentralized content sharing system
Understand the basics of the public DHT
Be able to explain what a peer, node, and swarm are in the context of IPFS

1.3.description: Learn about IPFS Gateways and how they help bridge information between web2 and web3

subgoals.description: Know the methods to address content in IPFS through Gateways
Get familiar with the work being done to bring native IPFS support to browsers
Learn about current public Gateways and how any node in the network can provide this service
Be able to name projects that use or build upon IPFS, and what those projects do

1.4.description: Be able to explain the basics of data transfer in IPFS

subgoals.description: Learn what is IPFS's message-oriented protocol to exchange data
Know what are the different message types and their order of operations
Understand what is the session and the ledger in the context of Bitswap
Explain the different components of Bitswap at a high level
Discover what advantages Graphsync has over Bitswap

1.5.description: Gain knowledge of the IPFS architecture and the different components and services

subgoals.description: Understand the flow of files that go through IPFS
Gain an introductory understanding of Linked Data
Demystify the core components that purely make up IPFS
Lean into technical details of mutable data on IPFS

1.6.description: Be able to explain the basics of UnixFS

subgoals.description: Understand what is UnixFS and what problem it solves
Learn how files with more than a single block are labeled
Go over the protobuf format, and its main field

1.0.description: Understand how and why IPLD was created

subgoals.description: Know what separates IPFS from IPLD
Know some of the use cases of IPLD
Have a basic background knowledge of what makes a CID

1.1.description: Understand how IPLD addresses data in a Content-Addressed system

subgoals.description: Identify the differences between CID versions and their properties
Understand the multiformats involved in generating a CID
Use the CID Inspector to break down and analyze CIDs

1.2.description: Be able to describe graph data structures and Merkle DAG

subgoals.description: Understand how a Merkle DAG is different from other type of graphs
Learn how files get broken down to DAGs
Learn what happens when a Merkle Dag is mutated

1.3.description: Understand how IPLD operates in the context of IPFS

subgoals.description: Understand the complete picture of adding a file to IPFS
Make sense of how UnixFS interoperates with DAG structures
Identify what kind of data types can you have in IPLD
Define the various encodings and data formats used in IPLD

1.4.description: Go over the underlying data types and formats in IPLD

subgoals.description: Understand the different types of data used with IPLD
Discover the default codec in IPFS and how it differs from other IPLD-native codecs
Describe how IPLD is interoperable with other addressed systems
Understand how Schemas provide encoding and storage convenience for application developers

1.5.description: Know how distributed data structures bring improvements to decentralized networks

1.6.description: Learn about the CAR format and how it helps data distribution

1.1.description: Understand what are Dev-Tools and why they are important for developers.

1.2.description: Get to know the main Dev-Tools available in the IPFS and Filecoin ecosystem.

1.3.description: Know how you can add you own Dev-Tools to the Launchpad curriculum, so that other people can learn about them.
